SOC1-1-1.Definition: Percentage of the population who report speaking their indigenous language every day
SOC1-1-1.Calculation/Formulation: (Total number of people that speak lanwis/vernacular indigenous langauge every day / Total population of that specific cultural group) * 100
SOC1-1-1.Range: Those who are eligible to be asked the question - population 12 years and older captures Vanuatu youth demographic
SOC1-1-1.Assumptions: People reporting "Daily Use" use lanwis/vernacular indigenous language more than once a day
SOC1-1-1.Limitations: This question is not included in the Census and does not distinguish between indigenous language groups, of which there are estimated 100+
SOC1-1-1.Purpose/Rationale: Measure prevalence of use of indigenous language for communication and proxy measure for traditional knowledge
SOC1-1-1.PolicyLinkage: Component of Melanesian Wellbeing Analysis, NSDP 1.1.1, Early Childhood Education vernacular policy

SOC1-1-1.graph_title: SOC 1.1.1 Proportion of population speaking indigenous language daily
